metadata.title: CVE-2023-52628 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nftables: exthdr: fix 4-byte stack OOB writeIf priv->len is a multiple of 4, then dst[len / 4] can write pastthe destination array which leads to stack corruption.This construct is necessary to clean the remainder of the registerin case ->len is NOT a multiple of the register size, so make itconditional just like nft_payload.c does.The bug was added in 4.1 cycle and then copied/inherited whentcp/sctp and ip option support was added.Bug reported by Zero Day Initiative project (ZDI-CAN-21950,ZDI-CAN-21951, ZDI-CAN-21961).

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
